Primitive Functions¶

:strike:`what`.

class strike¶
class what¶

What are you doing

ELI Table¶

Mixed¶

3.2 Dot (:)

3.3 Reduce (/)

3.4 Scan ()

Convensions¶

Name Description Explanation
PF(X,Y) Primitive function X: monadic; Y: dyadic
L Left argument Any type of data (optional)
R Right argument Any type of data (mandatory)
Z Return value Always available even it is a nil value
RHO Return shape The shape of a variable
TYPE Return type The type of a variable

! (iota,find)¶

  • Monadic (Z <- ! R)
  1. RHO(Z) = VECTOR, RHO(R) = VECTOR or SCALAR
  2. TYPE(R) = TYPE(Z) = INTEGER

Examples:

    !5
1 2 3 4 5
    !2.3
Error: domain error
    !2.3
    ^
  • Dyadic (Z <- L ! R)
  1. RHO(Z) = RHO(R)
  2. If TYPE(L) and TYPE(R) are NUMERIC, return the index of R in L if found or 0 otherwise
  3. Else always return 0
    5 1 7 9 3 7 ! 5
1
    5 1 7 9 3 7 ! 7
3

# (Rho,Reshape)¶

  • Monadic (Z <- # R)

Examples:

     #1 2 3
3
     #(1 2 3;'life';`symbol;2j3)
4
  • Dyadic (Z <- L # R)

< <= (Great_up,Less)¶

  • Monadic (Z <- <R)
      a
54 22 5 68 94 39 52 84 4 6
      <a  //returns index
9 3 10 2 6 7 1 4 8 5
      a[<a]
4 5 6 22 39 52 54 68 84 94
  • Dyadic (Z <- L<R)
      a
54 22 5 68 94 39 52 84 4 6
      a < 50
0 1 1 0 0 1 0 0 1 1

> >= (Great_down,Greater)¶

  • Monadic (Z <- >R)
      a
54 22 5 68 94 39 52 84 4 6
      >a //returns index
5 8 4 1 7 6 2 10 3 9
      a[>a]
94 84 68 54 52 39 22 6 5 4
  • Dyadic (Z <- L>R)
      a
54 22 5 68 94 39 52 84 4 6
      a > 50
1 0 0 1 1 0 1 1 0 0

^ (Count,And)¶

  • Monadic (Z <- ^R)
      ^ 1 0 1
3
  • Dyadic (Z <- L^R)
      1 0 1 ^ 0 1 1
0 0 1

& (–,Or)¶

  • Monadic (N/A)
  • Dyadic (Z <- L&R)
      1 0 1 & 0 1 1
1 1 1

!. (Execute,Drop)¶

  • Monadic (Z <- !.R)
      !.'2 + 3'
5
  • Dyadic (Z <- L!.R)
      1 !. 1 2 3
2 3

^. (Take1,Take)¶

  • Monadic (Z <- ^.R)
  • Dyadic (Z <- L^.R)

, (Ravel,Concatenate)¶

  • Monadic (Z <- ,R)
  • Dyadic (Z <- L,R)

+ (Sign,Plus)¶

  • Monadic (Z <- +R)
  • Dyadic (Z <- L+R)

- (Negative,Minus)¶

  • Monadic (Z <- -R)
  • Dyadic (Z <- L-R)

* (xxxx,Mutiply)¶

  • Monadic (Z <- *R)
  • Dyadic (Z <- L*R)

% (Single divide,Divide)¶

  • Monadic (Z <- %R)
  • Dyadic (Z <- L%R)

$ (Rotate)¶

  • Monadic (Z <- $R)
  • Dyadic (Z <- L$R)

&. (transpose)

*.
